isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE (WITH R-12 REFRIGERANT SYSTEM) - REFRIGERANT SYSTEM SERVICE - EVACUATING THE SYSTEM

svcproc.title: EVACUATING THE SYSTEM
svcproc.para: Whenever the air conditioning system has been opened, the system must be completely evacuated of air and moisture before being recharged.

Outlined below is the procedure for evacuating the system using the OEM-1387 Charging Station for R-12 air conditioning systems, and OEM-1416 for HFC-134A air conditioning systems. On the HFC-134A charging station, make sure the valves on the red and blue hoses at the metric SAE quick-disconnect fittings are closed.

step1.para: Connect the Charging Station to the compressor service ports as follows:

step2.para: Close all the valves on the Charging Station (turn fully clockwise).
Connect the blue suction gauge hose (low pressure) to the compressor suction service port.
Connect the red discharge gauge hose (high pressure) to the compressor discharge service port.
Connect the yellow hose from the center fitting on the manifold to the vacuum pump suction fitting on the charging station.
Open manifold suction and discharge gauge valves (turn fully counter- clockwise).
On HFC-134A metric SAE quick- disconnect fittings, turn the valves on the red and blue hoses completely on (turn counterclockwise).

step1.para: Start vacuum pump and SLOWLY open pump shutoff valve.
After suction gauge on manifold shows that vacuum is being established in the system, open vacuum gauge valve on the charging station and continue to operate the vacuum pump for ten (10) minutes.

Close pump shutoff valve and observe vacuum gauge for one minute. The meter should not indicate a rise of more than 5 millimeters of mercury. If the gauge rises more than 5 millimeters of mercury in one (1) minute, the system has a leak which must be repaired. If there is no leak, proceed to step 5.

Open pump shut-off valve and continue to operate vacuum pump for an additional twenty (20) minutes. Then close the pump shut-off valve and observe vacuum gauge. It the meter stays below 4 millimeters of mercury for two (2) minutes, the system is ready to be charged.
With the vacuum pump still operating, close both manifold gauge valves, pump shut-off and vacuum meter valves. Turn off vacuum pump.

note.para: Do not disconnect the manifold gauge hoses from the compressor service ports before charging the system.
